comments:
Build: I20050208 + platform core and UI from HEAD

I got the following error:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-02-11 10:34:23.12
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Flushing content description cache.".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.openElementData(ElementTree.java:869)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.getResourceInfo(Workspace.java:1139)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ContentDescriptionManager$1.visitElement(ContentDescriptionManager.java:76)
	at

	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.iterate(ElementTreeIterator.java:119)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ContentDescriptionManager$FlushJob.runInWorkspace(ContentDescriptionManager.java:84)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Actually I introduced this bug.  I previously said using WorspaceJob is
equivalent to beginOperation/endOperation.  This is not true, because we must
release our workspace lock when calling "client" code such as
WorkspaceJob.runInWorkspace.  This means the code in
ContentDescriptionManager.FlushJob is currently unsafe.

I will fix this, since I caused the bug <g>

Fixed, tested, and released.  Rafael, since this is your code I'd appreciate if
you can quickly look at the changes to see if they look reasonable.  I
essentially added back the begin/endOperation code you had in there previously.
